touristSites.name: Eiffel Tower
touristSites.description: An iconic iron lattice tower built for the 1889 World's Fair, symbolizing Paris and offering panoramic city views.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Observation decks with views of Paris, romantic ambiance, light shows in the evening, UNESCO proximity (Seine Banks).
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Trocadéro or Bir-Hakeim stations), near Paris airports (CDG, ORY).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for mild weather and fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Louvre Museum
touristSites.description: The world’s largest art museum, home to the Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, and thousands of artworks.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Iconic glass pyramid, vast art collection, historical palace, central location along the Seine.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Palais Royal-Musée du Louvre), near Paris airports.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Winter (November-March) for fewer crowds, except holiday peaks.

touristSites.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
touristSites.description: A historic Catholic cathedral known for its Gothic architecture and iconic twin towers.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Stained glass windows, ongoing restoration post-2019 fire, literary fame from Victor Hugo’s novel.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Cité or Saint-Michel), walkable from central Paris.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for pleasant weather.

touristSites.name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
touristSites.description: A Roman-Byzantine basilica atop Montmartre, offering stunning views of Paris.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: White travertine facade, panoramic views, vibrant Montmartre neighborhood, free entry.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Anvers), funicular to the top, near Paris city center.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Summer (June-August) for clear skies and views.

touristSites.name: Musée d’Orsay
touristSites.description: A museum in a former railway station, showcasing Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Works by Monet, Van Gogh, and Degas, stunning Beaux-Arts architecture, Seine River views.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Solférino), walkable from Louvre.

touristSites.name: Versailles Palace
touristSites.description: A royal palace with opulent interiors, extensive gardens, and the famous Hall of Mirrors.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, grand architecture, gardens with fountains, historical significance.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; train (RER C to Versailles-Château), 30 minutes from Paris center.

touristSites.name: Centre Pompidou
touristSites.description: A modern art museum with a distinctive high-tech architectural design.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Works by Picasso and Matisse, rooftop views, vibrant Marais district.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Rambuteau), central location.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but Spring (April-May) for pleasant weather.

touristSites.name: Arc de Triomphe
touristSites.description: A monumental arch honoring Napoleon’s victories, with an observation deck.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Panoramic views of Champs-Élysées, historical significance, central location.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Charles de Gaulle-Étoile), walkable from city center.

touristSites.name: Champs-Élysées
touristSites.description: A famous avenue lined with shops, theaters, and cafes, leading to the Arc de Triomphe.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Luxury shopping, vibrant atmosphere, proximity to major landmarks.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; multiple metro stations (Franklin D. Roosevelt, George V).

touristSites.name: Montmartre District
touristSites.description: A bohemian neighborhood known for its artistic history and charming streets.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Sacré-Cœur views, Place du Tertre with artists, historic cafes like Le Consulat.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Anvers or Abbesses), walkable but hilly.

touristSites.name: Seine River Cruise
touristSites.description: A boat tour along the Seine, showcasing Paris’s landmarks from the water.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Views of Notre-Dame, Louvre, and Eiffel Tower, romantic ambiance, dinner cruises.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; multiple departure points near metro stations.

touristSites.name: Les Invalides
touristSites.description: A complex housing Napoleon’s tomb and military museums.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Dome Church, Army Museum, historical significance, central location.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Invalides), near Eiffel Tower.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but Fall (September-October) for fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Panthéon
touristSites.description: A neoclassical monument housing the tombs of French luminaries like Voltaire and Rousseau.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Impressive architecture, crypt tours, Latin Quarter proximity.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Cardinal Lemoine), walkable from Notre-Dame.

touristSites.name: Jardin des Tuileries
touristSites.description: A historic garden between the Louvre and Place de la Concorde, with sculptures and fountains.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Relaxing green space, seasonal fairs, proximity to major museums.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Tuileries), central location.

touristSites.name: Jardin du Luxembourg
touristSites.description: A beautiful garden with the Luxembourg Palace, popular for leisurely strolls.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Medicis Fountain, statues, children’s activities, Latin Quarter vibe.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Luxembourg), walkable from Panthéon.

touristSites.name: Moulin Rouge
touristSites.description: A legendary cabaret known for its can-can performances and vibrant nightlife.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Iconic red windmill, evening shows, Montmartre nightlife.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Blanche), near Sacré-Cœur.

touristSites.name: Sainte-Chapelle
touristSites.description: A Gothic chapel famous for its stunning stained glass windows.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Colorful glass depicting biblical scenes, intimate setting, near Notre-Dame.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Cité), central location.

touristSites.name: Palais Garnier
touristSites.description: A grand opera house known for its opulent interiors and historical significance.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Chagall ceiling, grand staircase, Phantom of the Opera inspiration.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Opéra), central location.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but check for guided tours or performances.

touristSites.name: Marais District
touristSites.description: A historic district with narrow streets, trendy boutiques, and Jewish heritage.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Place des Vosges, Picasso Museum, vibrant cafes, historical charm.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Saint-Paul), walkable from city center.

touristSites.name: Catacombs of Paris
touristSites.description: An underground ossuary holding the remains of over six million people.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Unique historical experience, eerie tunnels, limited daily tickets.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Denfert-Rochereau), south of city center.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but book tickets in advance.

touristSites.name: Colosseum
touristSites.description: An ancient Roman amphitheater built in 70-80 AD, hosting gladiator contests and public spectacles.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, historical significance, guided tours of underground chambers, proximity to Roman Forum.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Colosseo station), near Rome Fiumicino Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (October-November) for pleasant weather.

touristSites.name: Roman Forum
touristSites.description: The ancient center of Roman public life, with ruins of temples and government buildings.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Archaeological significance, proximity to Colosseum, guided tours available.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Colosseo), walkable from central Rome.

touristSites.name: Pantheon
touristSites.description: A well-preserved Roman temple with a massive dome and oculus, now a church.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Architectural marvel, free entry, central location near Piazza Navona.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from central Rome, bus nearby.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Piazza Navona
touristSites.description: A lively square with Bernini’s Fountain of the Four Rivers and historic buildings.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Street artists, cafes, Baroque architecture, festive atmosphere.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Pantheon, central location.

touristSites.name: Trevi Fountain
touristSites.description: A Baroque fountain where visitors toss coins to ensure a return to Rome.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Iconic landmark, stunning sculptures, vibrant atmosphere, central location.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Barberini), walkable from city center.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Early morning or evening to avoid crowds.

touristSites.name: Spanish Steps
touristSites.description: A grand staircase connecting Piazza di Spagna with Trinità dei Monti church.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Romantic setting, shopping nearby, views from the top, free entry.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Spagna), central location.

touristSites.name: Vatican Museums
touristSites.description: A vast collection of art and historical artifacts, including the Sistine Chapel.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Michelangelo’s frescoes, Raphael Rooms, historical treasures, proximity to St. Peter’s.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Ottaviano), short walk from Vatican City.

touristSites.name: Castel Sant’Angelo
touristSites.description: A fortress and former papal residence with a rooftop offering panoramic views.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, Tiber River views, museum exhibits, near Vatican.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Vatican, bus nearby.

touristSites.name: Piazza del Popolo
touristSites.description: A large square with an Egyptian obelisk and twin churches, a gateway to Rome’s center.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Vibrant atmosphere, proximity to Villa Borghese, street performers.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Flaminio), walkable from Spanish Steps.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but evening for lively ambiance.

touristSites.name: Villa Borghese Gardens
touristSites.description: A large park with gardens, museums, and a small lake for boating.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Borghese Gallery, green oasis, bike rentals, family-friendly.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Spagna or Flaminio), near city center.

touristSites.name: Borghese Gallery
touristSites.description: An art gallery in Villa Borghese, showcasing works by Bernini and Caravaggio.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Masterpieces of Baroque art, limited entry for intimate experience, park setting.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Spagna), reservations recommended.

touristSites.name: Capitoline Museums
touristSites.description: The world’s oldest public museums, with Roman statues and artifacts.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Marcus Aurelius statue, views of Roman Forum, historical significance.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Colosseum, central location.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for quieter visits.

touristSites.name: Trastevere District
touristSites.description: A charming neighborhood with cobblestone streets and lively nightlife.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Local restaurants, Santa Maria in Trastevere, bohemian vibe.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; tram or bus from central Rome, walkable from Tiber River.

touristSites.name: Baths of Caracalla
touristSites.description: Ancient Roman public baths with impressive ruins and mosaics.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Archaeological site, summer opera performances, less crowded than Colosseum.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Circo Massimo), south of city center.

touristSites.name: Appian Way
touristSites.description: An ancient Roman road lined with ruins and catacombs.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, biking or walking trails, peaceful countryside setting.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus from Rome, bike rentals available.

touristSites.name: Campo de’ Fiori
touristSites.description: A lively square with a daily market and historical significance.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Fresh produce, local vibe, nearby restaurants, statue of Giordano Bruno.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Pantheon, central location.

touristSites.name: Aventine Hill
touristSites.description: One of Rome’s seven hills, known for its gardens and keyhole view of St. Peter’s.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Orange Garden, Knights of Malta keyhole, quiet escape from city bustle.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Circo Massimo), walkable from Trastevere.

touristSites.name: Piazza Venezia
touristSites.description: A central square with the imposing Victor Emmanuel II Monument.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, proximity to Roman Forum, vibrant atmosphere.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Colosseum, bus nearby.

touristSites.name: Catacombs of San Callisto
touristSites.description: Underground Christian burial sites with ancient frescoes and tunnels.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical and spiritual significance, guided tours, quieter experience.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus from central Rome, near Appian Way.

touristSites.name: National Roman Museum
touristSites.description: A museum with Roman artifacts across multiple sites, including Palazzo Massimo.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Roman mosaics, statues, frescoes, central location near Termini station.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Termini), walkable from city center.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for quieter visits.

touristSites.name: Sagrada Familia
touristSites.description: Antoni Gaudí’s unfinished modernist basilica, known for its unique architecture and intricate facades.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, stunning interiors with stained glass, Gaudí’s masterpiece, rooftop views.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Sagrada Família station), near Barcelona-El Prat Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (March-May) or Fall (September-November) for mild weather.

touristSites.name: Park Güell
touristSites.description: A public park designed by Gaudí, featuring colorful mosaics and whimsical structures.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, panoramic views, Gaudí’s unique style, family-friendly.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Lesseps), bus or taxi recommended due to hilly terrain.

touristSites.name: Casa Batlló
touristSites.description: A Gaudí-designed house with a colorful, organic facade and innovative interiors.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, immersive audio tours, central Eixample location.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Passeig de Gràcia), walkable from city center.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: La Rambla
touristSites.description: A vibrant pedestrian street lined with shops, cafes, and street performers.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Lively atmosphere, La Boqueria market, proximity to Gothic Quarter.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Liceu or Drassanes), central location.

touristSites.name: Gothic Quarter
touristSites.description: A historic neighborhood with narrow medieval streets and Roman remnants.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Barcelona Cathedral, Plaça Sant Jaume, trendy bars, historical charm.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Jaume I), walkable from La Rambla.

touristSites.name: Barcelona Cathedral
touristSites.description: A Gothic cathedral with intricate facades and a serene cloister.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Stained glass, rooftop access, central Gothic Quarter location.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Jaume I), walkable from city center.

touristSites.name: Casa Milà (La Pedrera)
touristSites.description: A Gaudí-designed building with a wavy stone facade and rooftop chimneys.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, rooftop views, cultural exhibitions, Eixample district.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Diagonal), near Casa Batlló.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but evening for night tours.

touristSites.name: Montjuïc Castle
touristSites.description: A hilltop fortress with military history and panoramic views of Barcelona.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: City and port views, historical exhibits, nearby Montjuïc Park.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; cable car or bus from city center, metro (Paral·lel).

touristSites.name: Picasso Museum
touristSites.description: A museum showcasing Pablo Picasso’s early works and connection to Barcelona.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Extensive Picasso collection, Gothic Quarter setting, historical buildings.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Jaume I), walkable from city center.

touristSites.name: La Boqueria Market
touristSites.description: A vibrant food market offering fresh produce, tapas, and local delicacies.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Culinary experience, colorful stalls, central location on La Rambla.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Liceu), walkable from Gothic Quarter.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Morning for fresh produce and fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Camp Nou
touristSites.description: The iconic stadium of FC Barcelona, one of the world’s most famous football clubs.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Museum tours, pitch views, football history, family-friendly.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Collblanc), west of city center.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but match days for atmosphere.

touristSites.name: Tibidabo Amusement Park
touristSites.description: A historic amusement park on Tibidabo hill with rides and city views.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Family-friendly, panoramic views, Sagrat Cor temple nearby.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; funicular or bus from city center, metro (Tibidabo).

touristSites.name: Poble Espanyol
touristSites.description: An open-air museum showcasing replicas of Spanish architectural styles.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Cultural exhibits, artisan shops, family-friendly, near Montjuïc.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; bus or metro (Espanya), near Montjuïc Castle.

touristSites.name: Barceloneta Beach
touristSites.description: A popular urban beach with a lively promenade and Mediterranean views.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Sunbathing, seafood restaurants, water sports, vibrant atmosphere.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Barceloneta), walkable from city center.

touristSites.name: Palau de la Música Catalana
touristSites.description: A modernist concert hall with stunning stained glass and mosaics.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, guided tours, vibrant performances.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Urquinaona), near Gothic Quarter.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but check for concert schedules.

touristSites.name: MONTJUÏC Magic Fountain
touristSites.description: A fountain with choreographed light and music shows, located near Plaça d’Espanya.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Evening shows, family-friendly, near Montjuïc attractions.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Espanya), walkable from city center.

touristSites.name: MNAC (National Art Museum of Catalonia)
touristSites.description: A museum showcasing Catalan art, including Romanesque frescoes and modernist works.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Palau Nacional setting, city views, extensive art collection.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Espanya), near Montjuïc Castle.

touristSites.name: Parc de la Ciutadella
touristSites.description: A large park with a lake, zoo, and the Catalan Parliament building.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Boating, green spaces, family-friendly, near Arc de Triomf.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Arc de Triomf), walkable from Gothic Quarter.

touristSites.name: Arc de Triomf
touristSites.description: A triumphal arch built for the 1888 Barcelona Universal Exposition.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Photo opportunities, proximity to Parc de la Ciutadella, free entry.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Arc de Triomf), central location.

touristSites.name: Tibidabo Sagrat Cor Temple
touristSites.description: A hilltop church with a statue of the Sacred Heart and panoramic city views.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Stunning vistas, neo-Gothic architecture, near Tibidabo Amusement Park.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; funicular or bus from city center, metro (Tibidabo).

touristSites.name: Acropolis
touristSites.description: A 5th-century BC citadel with the Parthenon, a temple dedicated to Athena, overlooking Athens.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, ancient Greek architecture, panoramic views, nearby Acropolis Museum.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Acropoli station), near Athens International Airport.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) to avoid heat.

touristSites.name: Acropolis Museum
touristSites.description: A modern museum showcasing artifacts from the Acropolis and ancient Athens.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Glass floors revealing excavations, Parthenon marbles, views of Acropolis.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Acropoli), walkable from Acropolis.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: National Archaeological Museum
touristSites.description: One of the world’s greatest museums, housing artifacts from ancient Greece.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Antikythera Mechanism, Mycenaean gold, extensive collections.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Omonia or Victoria), central location.

touristSites.name: Plaka District
touristSites.description: A historic neighborhood at the foot of the Acropolis with charming streets and tavernas.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Traditional Greek dining, boutique shops, Anafiotika’s Cycladic vibe.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Monastiraki), walkable from Acropolis.

touristSites.name: Monastiraki Square
touristSites.description: A bustling square with a flea market, historic mosque, and views of the Acropolis.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Vibrant atmosphere, street food, shopping, proximity to Agora.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Monastiraki), central location.

touristSites.name: Ancient Agora
touristSites.description: The heart of ancient Athens, with ruins of civic buildings and the Temple of Hephaestus.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Well-preserved temple, historical significance, green setting.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Monastiraki), walkable from Plaka.

touristSites.name: Temple of Olympian Zeus
touristSites.description: A colossal temple dedicated to Zeus, with massive Corinthian columns.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, proximity to National Garden, Hadrian’s Arch nearby.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Acropoli), walkable from city center.

touristSites.name: National Garden
touristSites.description: A lush urban park with ponds, a small zoo, and shaded pathways.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Relaxing green space, family-friendly, near Syntagma Square.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Syntagma), central location.

touristSites.name: Syntagma Square
touristSites.description: Athens’ central square, home to the Greek Parliament and changing of the guard.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, vibrant atmosphere, proximity to major sites.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Syntagma), walkable from Plaka.

touristSites.name: Lycabettus Hill
touristSites.description: A hill offering panoramic views of Athens, with a funicular to the top.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Sunset views, small chapel, open-air theater in summer.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; funicular or taxi from city center, metro (Evangelismos).

touristSites.name: Benaki Museum
touristSites.description: A museum showcasing Greek art and history from antiquity to the 20th century.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Diverse collections, elegant mansion setting, near Syntagma.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Syntagma), walkable from city center.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for quieter visits.

touristSites.name: Hadrian’s Arch
touristSites.description: A Roman-era arch built to honor Emperor Hadrian, near the Temple of Olympian Zeus.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, photo opportunities, central location.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Acropoli), walkable from National Garden.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for fewer crowds.

touristSites.name: Kerameikos Cemetery
touristSites.description: An ancient cemetery with ruins and a small museum of funerary artifacts.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Archaeological site, quiet setting, historical insights.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; metro (Kerameikos), near Monastiraki.

touristSites.name: Anafiotika
touristSites.description: A tiny Cycladic-style neighborhood on the slopes of the Acropolis.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Whitewashed houses, narrow alleys, Acropolis views, hidden gem.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Plaka, metro (Monastiraki).

touristSites.name: Museum of Cycladic Art
touristSites.description: A museum focused on ancient Cycladic and Greek art, with iconic figurines.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Unique artifacts, modern exhibits, near Kolonaki district.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Evangelismos), walkable from Syntagma.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for quieter visits.

touristSites.name: Stavros Niarchos Cultural Center
touristSites.description: A modern complex with a library, opera house, and park designed by Renzo Piano.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Free events, green spaces, sea views, family-friendly.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; bus or taxi from city center, near Piraeus.

touristSites.name: Roman Agora
touristSites.description: A smaller ancient marketplace with the Tower of the Winds.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, compact site, near Monastiraki.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Monastiraki), walkable from Plaka.

touristSites.name: Panathenaic Stadium
touristSites.description: A marble stadium rebuilt for the first modern Olympics in 1896.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, audio tours, scenic setting near National Garden.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Acropoli), walkable from city center.

touristSites.name: Kolonaki District
touristSites.description: An upscale neighborhood with chic cafes, boutiques, and museums.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Trendy vibe, proximity to Benaki Museum, relaxed atmosphere.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; metro (Evangelismos), walkable from Syntagma.

touristSites.name: Cape Sounion
touristSites.description: A coastal site with the Temple of Poseidon overlooking the Aegean Sea.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Stunning sunset views, ancient ruins, day trip from Athens.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus or car from Athens (1-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Evening for sunsets, Spring (April-May) for mild weather.

touristSites.name: Alhambra
touristSites.description: A 13th-century Islamic palace and fortress, showcasing Moorish architecture and intricate tilework.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, Patio of the Lions, Generalife gardens, stunning views of Granada.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus or taxi from Granada center, near Málaga Airport (1.5-hour drive).
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-May) or Fall (September-October) for pleasant weather.

touristSites.name: Generalife
touristSites.description: The summer palace and gardens of the Alhambra, known for their lush greenery and water features.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, serene gardens, Moorish architecture, Alhambra proximity.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; included in Alhambra ticket, bus or taxi from Granada center.

touristSites.name: Granada Cathedral
touristSites.description: A Renaissance cathedral with a grand interior and ornate chapels.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Royal Chapel with Catholic Monarchs’ tombs, central location, historical significance.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Granada city center, bus nearby.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for quieter visits.

touristSites.name: Royal Chapel
touristSites.description: A Gothic chapel housing the tombs of Ferdinand and Isabella, the Catholic Monarchs.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, ornate altarpiece, near Granada Cathedral.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from city center, central location.

touristSites.name: Albaicín District
touristSites.description: A historic Muslim quarter with narrow streets and whitewashed houses.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: UNESCO World Heritage Site, Mirador de San Nicolás, authentic Andalusian vibe.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; bus or walk from city center, hilly terrain.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Evening for sunset views from miradors.

touristSites.name: Mirador de San Nicolás
touristSites.description: A viewpoint in Albaicín offering stunning views of the Alhambra and Sierra Nevada.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Iconic sunset spot, lively atmosphere, nearby cafes and flamenco shows.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; bus or walk from city center, steep climb in Albaicín.

touristSites.name: Sacromonte District
touristSites.description: A historic Gypsy neighborhood known for cave houses and flamenco culture.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Flamenco shows in caves, Sacromonte Abbey, unique cultural heritage.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus or taxi from city center, hilly terrain.

touristSites.name: Sacromonte Caves Museum
touristSites.description: A museum showcasing the history and lifestyle of Granada’s cave dwellers.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Authentic cave houses, cultural exhibits, scenic Sacromonte setting.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; bus or taxi to Sacromonte, hilly terrain.

touristSites.name: Carrera del Darro
touristSites.description: A picturesque street along the Darro River, lined with historic buildings.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Romantic ambiance, views of Alhambra, proximity to Albaicín and Plaza Nueva.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from city center, near bus stops.

touristSites.name: El Bañuelo
touristSites.description: An 11th-century Arab bathhouse, one of the best-preserved in Spain.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Moorish architecture, historical insights, compact site in Albaicín.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; walkable from Carrera del Darro, central location.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for quieter visits.

touristSites.name: Plaza Nueva
touristSites.description: A lively square at the base of Albaicín, with cafes and historical buildings.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Central location, vibrant atmosphere, proximity to Alhambra and cathedral.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from city center, bus nearby.

touristSites.name: Monastery of San Jerónimo
touristSites.description: A Renaissance monastery with an ornate church and cloister.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Historical significance, intricate architecture, quieter than major sites.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; walkable from city center, near bus stops.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for peaceful visits.

touristSites.name: Corral del Carbón
touristSites.description: A 14th-century caravanserai, the only fully preserved one in Spain.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Moorish architecture, cultural events, central location near cathedral.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Plaza Nueva, central location.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but check for cultural performances.

touristSites.name: Science Park (Parque de las Ciencias)
touristSites.description: An interactive science museum with exhibits on astronomy, biology, and technology.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Family-friendly, planetarium, outdoor experiments, modern facilities.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; bus or taxi from city center, south of Granada.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but weekends for family visits.

touristSites.name: Paseo de los Tristes
touristSites.description: A scenic promenade along the Darro River with views of the Alhambra.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Romantic setting, riverside cafes, proximity to Albaicín.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from Plaza Nueva, central location.

touristSites.name: Carmen de los Mártires
touristSites.description: A romantic garden with ponds, peacocks, and views of the Alhambra.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Tranquil setting, free entry, near Alhambra grounds.
touristSites.accessibility: Moderate; walk or bus from city center, near Alhambra.

touristSites.name: Basilica of San Juan de Dios
touristSites.description: A Baroque church with a lavish gold-decorated interior.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Stunning decor, historical significance, central location.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from city center, near cathedral.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for quieter visits.

touristSites.name: Huerta de San Vicente
touristSites.description: The summer home of poet Federico García Lorca, now a museum.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Literary history, intimate setting, cultural exhibits.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; bus or walk from city center, south of Granada.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but check for guided tours.

touristSites.name: Plaza de Bib-Rambla
touristSites.description: A historic square with cafes and a central fountain, known for its lively atmosphere.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Local vibe, nearby shops, proximity to cathedral.
touristSites.accessibility: Excellent; walkable from city center, central location.

touristSites.name: Monastery of La Cartuja
touristSites.description: A Baroque monastery with an ornate sacristy and cloister.
touristSites.visitorAppeal: Architectural beauty, historical significance, quieter than major sites.
touristSites.accessibility: Good; bus or taxi from city center, north of Granada.
touristSites.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round, but morning for peaceful visits.
